Tracey/Wendy/Nicole & Krystyna xx
title: Wow what an amazing place - loved it!!

text:
Stayed in Villa 10 at The Residence in Seminyak for 4 nights with 5 friends for a girls weekend away. 
I can not recommend this Villa enough. It was located centrally to everything Seminyak offers including fine dining, cafes, shopping centre, markets and day spas. 
Our Butler Dwin did an amazing villa cooked breakfast every morning at a time of our choice. The menu had something to suit all. Dwin also ensured the villa was clean at all times. He even very kindly went to the shops for us a few times to pick up essentials we forgot. 
The pool was amazing and so nice to relax around. However, the outdoor setting only had 4 outdoor chairs even though the villa can sleep 8. This was easily fixed by bringing 2 chairs from indoor dining table outside. 
Bumbim was our evening Butler from 3-6. He did a fantastic turn down in all rooms and sprayed the rooms for mosquitoes before he finished. 
Stay here and be spoiled.
title: Villa Shanti/villa 10

text:
Couldn’t have been more overjoyed with our stay! 
The staff were incredible, the check in and booking were seamless and everyone was so professional!

The villa senang was spectacular with never a thing out of place! I was in heaven! 
Massive pool, beautiful rooms, big kitchen and living space!

Our butlers were friendly and provided excellent service! 

Will be returning ASAP!
title: Villa Senang - incredible!

text:
We had 10 days at The Residences in Villa Zensa. My husband and I were blown away by this place. We have stayed in private pool villas in Bali numerous times but none of those came close to this.

Everything was perfect. Design, layout, furnishings, bathroom, living area, bedroom - 10/10. My one and only complaint was the huge steps you had to take to get into the pool. I slipped and banged my leg & back on my first try. Fortunately when I asked they found a little step ladder to make it a bit easier to get in and out of the water.

Breakfast was cooked and served in your villa. A huge fridge so you could store your own food and drinks. TV & DVD player in the living room. Outside were 2 deck chairs, 2 beanbags, a lounge area and a dining area as well as an outdoor shower. We just loved our 10 days here and will definitely return!
title: Perfect across the board

text: A group of us (5 adults) stayed at the Residence in villa Siam for 11 days. The villa was beautiful with all rooms having their own bathroom. We had our own plunge pool and upstairs gazebo area, plenty of space for 5 adults to relax and have space if you wanted it. The villa was kept spotlessly clean by the wonderful staff who were always cheerful and happy. The wonderful butlers Made and Wayan cooked our breakfast daily and they did a superb job. We tried all their breakfasts on the menu and they were all prepared to perfection. Made and Wayan were always helpful making sure we were happy. Made organised our washing for us that came back the next day clean, ironed and folded. I would highly recommend staying at the residence, you will not be disappointed.
title: Villa Siam

text: I can’t count the amount of times that I have been to Bali, but I would have say the The Residence just gets more and more beautiful every year. The service that my family and friends receive here is outstanding. Thanks to ”Gede” and “Ketut” for another amazing holiday, it would not have been the same without your beautiful service, you feel like family. See you next year xxx or maybe sooner X
title: Heaven

text:
We stayed here for 9 nights in a 3 bedroom villa. As we had our 14 year old son with us as well as my mother, we choose to have access to only 2 of these rooms and had the second one set up in a twin layout. The villa itself was superbly set out and had everything we could possibly have wanted. It included a butler and breakfast chef as well as 24 hour security. All the staff spoke excellent English and went above and beyond to answer our questions and help us out.
The pool was sensational and we made use of it all the time. The bedrooms each had their own ensuite and outdoor shower or spa bath and there was a constant supply of filtered water available.
We could not fault this and can’t wait to come back again.a huge shout out to Gulwi and Liana for their fabulous care and attention and to the staff in the main office who were all very helpful.
title: Private villa with the lot

text:
It is a very nice villa with all the facilities. 
Housekeeping staff is really nice and helpful. It is surrounded with many restaurants and bars. The in charge Devi has been very supportive and wonderful person and Ratri at Vila 4. We lost a valuable chain and they found it and delivered to the airport. Thank you all. We had a wonderful holiday in Bali
title: Great place of sanity

text:
The Residence Seminyak was a complete dream from start to finish. I could not have imagined residing in a better set of Villas during my vacation in Bali. From the moment we entered the property, we were greeted with cold towels and a delicious pineapple cocktail! Since it was my sister's birthday, I had her room pre-decorated before our arrival. All I did was provide an example to my Villa Consultant Christine Samoal (who was a complete delight from start to finish while assisting me in planning my stay. She deserves 5 stars!!), and they executed it beautifully! My sister was so surprised when she opened the door! We enjoyed all of the amenities and scrumptious breakfast every morning prepared by our 5 star rated butler Galah! She gave us such great recommendations on where to go while in Bali, and even prepared our entire breakfast for us the day before their Balinese New Year the next day so that we would have something to eat (the entire city shuts down and nothing including restaurants are open for the entire day). The reasoning for the 4 star instead of 5 is because we did have a small rodent issue in our garden area on the last day we were in the Villa (I guess they got in from the street), but the Villa Manager WeeDe (sorry for the misspelling) was so prompt in getting the maintenance team out to rectify the situation. 

Overall I cannot complain! I enjoyed my stay here and will stay again if back in Bali in the future. I would definitely like to try out the other Villas in the residency.
title: Bali Dream at Villa Lanai!!

text:
Our stay at Villa Shanti was amazing made all that much better by the staff. Can not speak highly enough of Dewin. From the amazing breakfast he prepared to the organising of transport, Dewin was always very helpful & super friendly. 
The villa it's self was spotless & the pool checked & cleaned everyday. The very spacious villa is perfect for any family or group of friends no complaints at all. Would stay here again no worries. 
Larissa
title: Villa Shanti (The Residence) Seminyak - Amazing!!!

text:
We highly recommend Villa Zensa for a holiday in Bali, so much so we’re returning for another week at the end of April. It was renovated in October 2017 and is ideally located, within walking distance of Eat St and Seminyak Square and a short taxi ride to many cafes and restaurants. 
The Villa had absolutely everything to make your stay really enjoyable. The staff are super friendly and helpful. A special thank you to Gahli our butler for yummy breakfasts, Wayan for when he filled in for Gahli, Dina our house keeper for keeping our Villa spick and span, our gardener and pool man. Also thank you to the management team Nurul, Dewik, Widi, everyone who made our holiday special. Can’t wait to see you all again in April.
title: Villa Zensa - Magnifcent

text: Have just returned from a 10 day stay in Bali with 5 other families with all of us staying at the Residence Seminyak.  The staff, from the office to the villa staff, security and grounds people were awesome.  So friendly and smiling at all times.  The individual villas are beautiful and all uniquely a little different.  We stayed in Villa Siam, which was perfect for our family of four.  Each Villa has its own Butlers. Our Butler Made and Tedi (on Made's day off) were very helpful and friendly making the stay very enjoyable and relaxing.  Siam is the Villa with less sun around the pool than the others but has a great gazebo upstairs.  The only thing I would suggest would be more seating around the pool would be good.  But that is just a minor thing.  Would definitely stay again as the location of The Residence in Seminyak is very central to everything.
title: Relaxed luxury

text: We had a group of 5 families for 10 days and rented 5 villas in the Residence compound.The location is very central to shops and eat street (a 10-15 min walk to the beach) and the villas themselves are luxurious, spacious and perfectly suited to our needs.  Our butler was very friendly and helpful as were all the staff who went out of their way to organise anything we requested.  I would visit again and highly recommend these villas for a high end experience in Seminyak.
title: Beautifully appointed villas in the heart of Seminyak

text:
Do yourself a favour and treat yourself to a stay at The Residence Seminyak. 
It was honestly the most relaxing holiday, exactly what we were after.
 
My husband, 1 year old son and I, plus another couple and their 1 year old daughter stayed at The Residence for 8 nights. From the 28th December 2017 until the 5th of January 2018 in the two bedroom Villa Alayla. 

The location was perfect for us, as it's a short walk to the popular Eat Street in Seminyak, plus around the corner from our fave restaurants like Boss Burger, Sisterfields and Grocer and Grind. 

There is a housekeeper and butler assigned to your villa each day. They don't both stay there the entire shift, usually they both cook breakfast (at whatever time you request) and clean the rooms then they leave. 
We weren't sure of what other services they offered, i.e ordering groceries, (so we could cook food for the babies). I've heard of other 'butlers' in villas that will make drinks at your request, order food, however that's not the level of service here. And if it is it must not be readily asked as when we asked for them to purchase a few groceries, fruit and veg for the bubs they did it the first time however the following time the Butler asked if we could do it? We didn't want to be rude and ask them something that wasn't the service offered so we didn't push it. However looking on the website they do say "The will also assist you with any reservations for restaurants, spas, tours etc, and will go that step further to purchase groceries or any other shopping on your behalf, and will act as your personal guide or interpreter.' 

The villas are immaculately kept, with a gardener also visiting every day to sweep and clean the private pool. 

I had seen some older reviews about people complaining about mosquitos. I literally didn't see one mosquito the entire time I was there. They spray the rooms each night for mosquitos. It definitely isn't an issue.

The staff are all so nice and accomodating I can't rate them highly enough. 
I would come back and stay with my family again and again. 

I definitely recommend it!
title: Paradise in the Heart of Seminyak

owner_response.text:
Dear Aleesha

Thank you for your detailed review, our staff loved looking after you all.

We are sorry that you didn't get the 5* service that we promised. All our staff have been re-trained to assist our guests with anything they need, and hopefully this lack of service wont happen again.

Best regards from all of us at The Residence Seminyak

text: Residence is a beautiful Villa Property with private luxury villas. We were a group of 10 people all family, stayed in Villa Amman. Beautiful pool and jacuzzi. Morning fixed breakfast prepared and served by personal butler.  Kids enjoyed the stay and after 5 nights we were longing for more.
title: Villa Amman Beautiful place for a Family Outing

text: Villa Zensa is different than the other villas, fancy modern red & white design with a large covered terrace along its private swimming pool. Just within 5 minutes walking from the major street in Seminyak and 10minutes walking from the fancy beach bars, we can highly recommend this villa.
title: Villa Zensa

text: Wow, everything that we expected and more. Thank you to the wonderful staff who took such great care of us each day cooking breakfast, tidying the villa, cleaning the pool and outdoor areas and being so kind and friendly to us and our young Grandchildren. As promised, a well installed metal pool fence had been erected the day of our arrival, the pool is lovely. Rooms are well air conditioned and have ceiling fans and massive well equipped bathrooms with rain showers and giant bath/spa bath. Can not recommend highly enough. The villa is located within a secure, small complex, incredible quietness away from the hustle, bustle and noise if the seminar streets and an easy five minute walk to Eat Street, Seminyak Square and just a few minutes further to Ku De Ta, La Lucciola etc. Highly recommended and we look forward to returning on future holidays in Bali

text:
Amazing space, fantastic Villa, location great - highly recommend. 

We stayed for 12 days. The space in the Villa meant that we all could escape for quiet time as well as enjoy each other’s company. 

The pool was big enough to do laps and our housekeeper kept our Villa ship shape so we didn’t have to worry about a thing. 

Having your breakfast cooked every morning meant I got a total relaxing break 💖. 

Location ideal close to great restaurants, shopping and the beach.
title: Villa Amalia

text: We stayed for 12 nights at Villa Lanai at the start of July. We booked through Bali Villa Escapes. We were very excited at having our own villa and were not disappointed. The reception was great, we were greeted with cold towels and fresh juice. The Villa was everything we hoped for and the service was excellent. We had a small issue with a fan in the main bedroom, but while we were out they fitted a new one. The breakfasts and service were awesome and Dina who did our breakfasts and cleaning was an absolute delight. Could not have been more pleased.
title: Wonderful stay

text:
I stayed in a 3 bedroom villa with 7 friends. Even though we had an extra person they were readily available to provide us with another bed which was great. The villa organised 2 cars to pick us up from the airport.

The staff are absolutely lovely and very accommodating. When we arrived into our villa, we were greeted by Eka who was the supervisor. We had a brief chat and we spoke about the usual things while settling into our villa. We were greeted with pineapple juice and we got to know our maid - Kadek who is the most patient person you'll meet. She is so friendly and very welcoming. 

In terms of housekeeping, everything was always left perfectly. Kadek would love clean up everything even if we left a mess the night before (thank youuuu). The swimming pool and gardens was always kept clean and maintained by Wayan or Wayah? 

The staff at reception was always so helpful. Kadek, Widi and Eka in particular was always attentive to our requests eg. calling up to make a reservation at a restaurant. And they would always call to confirm with us and make sure we were happy with the times. 

The villa itself was beautiful. It was definitely enough for 7 girls. The lounge room was big enough to fit all of us and the floors were always spotless. Fresh towels each morning and refills of mosquito repellent. 

Breakfast was always served on time.

The location of this residence was very close to Seminyak. It was only a 10min walk which was great for us. 

When it was time to go home, transport to the airport was organised. They allowed us to wait inside reception until it was time to leave. 

I enjoyed my overall experience here at The Residence. I haven't had this kind of service in a long time. The staff again were absolutely amazing.
title: Girls trip.

text: this is indeed my second stay at Residence Seminyak ( Villa Jepun ). text: Well where do I start...from the moment we walked in till the moment we left (7 days) Villa Senang was just beautiful. We stayed in the Villa (family of 7 adults) and everything was perfect thanks to Gede and his team. Gede was our Butler and he made us feel so welcome, he went out of his way to accommodate anything we asked for. The Villa itself is absolutely lovely, from the perfect location, the cleanliness, facilities etc, we couldn't have asked for more. Rooms are spacious, all airconditioned and fans so sleeping temperature was perfect. The Master bedroom has shower and bath, the second bedroom on the ground floor just has a shower. The 3rd bedroom upstairs only has a bath. The 4th bedroom upstairs had both bath and shower. The pool is positioned perfectly with a few trees around for shade. Plenty of outdoor seating for everyone including a daybed which has a roof, fan and light. Every evening the outdoor lights came on at 6pm and turned off at 5am - this looked beautiful at night. The interior of the living area is very Balinese and extremely comfortable. Again fans and airconditioning to suit your temperature. The living dining area is very spacious so we never felt like we were tripping over each other. An added bonus to the Villa is it is the last one down the driveway so very private and we loved the fact that there was 24 hour security at the gate. Thank you again to Gede - you made our holiday so enjoyable and relaxing...
title: Absolutely Amazing Villa Senang!!!

text:
We stayed at the 2 king bed Villa Zensa with our two young kids (5 & 7yo).

text:
We have chosen the 5 rooms villa since we had 9 ppls to go with us. It was a memorable experience to us. 

Rooms:
The rooms are tidy, clean enough, although not very big. Bubble bath, bathing salt were provided. Air-conditioning is good, however, the room was very dark. Anti-Mosquito sprays were provided in rooms since there were many in Bali villas. However, they were not really that useful and we were stung every nights.

Common area:
A clean swimming pool around 1.5m in depth with sunbathing chairs located by side. There was a kitchen, a living room, with a HD TV containing loads of movies. We had breakfast in the dining area with is comfortable, a Ipod with speaker was provided in the dining area for audible enjoyment.

Services:
Service was fantastic! We have got two butlers, one in day-time and one in evening time (Both were called Made). They were nice and caring. Whenever we had questions about our itinerary. They just helped us and helped us contact with the drivers, restaurants, trip company..etc. They served us with drinks whenever we came back to the villa, provided all the things we wanted. 
We had a bad experience at the first night since one of our friends got his mobile robbed by a man on motorcycle. The butlers were disappointed and worried about us and contact with the manager. The manager came to us in the next morning and brought us to the police station the next day.
Overall, the area was clean and tidy, and the service was nice and we feel so warm in the villa with both butlers, Made and Made.
title: Excellent villa, Excellent services

owner_response.text:
Dear KelvinKKK

Your review is very much appreciated, thank you.

Since your stay, we have made sure that the rooms have better lighting, so darkness should not be a problem anymore. Mosquitoes tend to be quite active all over Bali in the morning and at dusk, so we recommend that guests protect themselves, but we will regularly spray the gardens to reduce their activity as much as possible, and certainly this was one of the reasons all our villas have enclosed living spaces, so guests remain free of them.

All our staff appreciate your comments and we always forward on these complements

Best regards from all of us at The Residence

text:
The villa we stayed in was nice - not as "Balinese" as some of the others in the same complex - really we could have been staying anywhere, so that was a little disappointing. It was however clean, well maintained and well presented.

I read an earlier review which says not to bother about the breakfast - we couldn't agree more - it was very ordinary at no fault of the staff who prepare it, but rather the budget allowed for it. We were served "Jungle Juice" rather than fresh juice which is readily available and delicious in Bali. The pastries were extremely ordinary and delicious pastries are available at retail outlets nearby in Seminyak. We opted to have breakfast at nearby restaurants on a couple of occasions and much preferred the experience. We have stayed in villas in Bali before where breakfast has been prepared in our room at a far higher standard, so we know it is possible. The budget was just stingy.

The wifi did not work well in the lounge room/dining room of the villa. The only place where it was reasonably effective was out by the pool - this was okay, but just okay, as we were not there just to holiday, but to do work as well, and it can be exceptionally hot outside in the middle of a Bali day, so the wifi experience was particularly ordinary.

The staff were delightful. Overall we enjoyed the stay, but it doesn't take much to reduce the overall experience. These villas are not cheap to stay in and the very least that international travellers expect is wifi. Properties should not offer breakfast with the belief that they are doing the guest a great favour unless it is a really enjoyable experience. We certainly didn't need to walk far to find first class produce that could have been offered to us at breakfast or to find first class breakfast cafes.

I wish I could be more positive. If wifi and breakfast aren't an issue for you, then I am certain you will have a lovely time. Just don't expect your laundry back on the same day, despite what the laundry sheet says! And even if it comes back the next day, don't expect it to be white or crisply ironed.
title: Needs Improvement To Justify Position In Market

owner_response.text:

Wifi has definitely been improved and all our services within the villa changed for the better.

If you were to visit again, we hope that you would be impressed.

Best regards from all of us at The Residence, Seminyak

text:
There were 3 of us ladies that stayed in a 2.5 bedroom villa in May 2013 and it was fabulous ! There was plenty of room for us to have our own time. We had the roof top area to relax as well, which consisted of 2 sun beds and an area in the shade with a sun lounge .  The breakfasts in the morning were fantastic, all cooked for us every morning. The pool was lovely, bigger than most lap pools and it had full sun which made it warm to swim in ! Evening swims were lots of fun. 

The staff were great, nothing was a problem. They booked all our restaurants for us in advance. 

The location was great and so central to seminyak restaurants, spas and the shops !  We actually walked to most places and were down the road from grocer and grind for the last minute nibbles. Despite the location being so close to everything it was so quiet during the day and peaceful at night. 

We will definitely go back !
title: Our stay at The Residence

text:
When booking this accommodation online we had the option to "fast track" through immigration upon arrival in Bali. We took this option at a cost of $35 US each. Straight off the plane and a lady was standing with our names on paper and whisked us (what seemed like instantly) straight through airport. Other passengers were looking on in shock as they waited in line. This was a great choice and start of our trip!
As we neared the exit she accompanied us to our driver sent from the Villa, who also had our names clearly stated. He had a trolley waiting, loaded our bags with a smile then led us to the Villa's transport van that was refreshingly air conditioned.
Once we arrived we were dropped off straight at the door of #7 Villa and the driver efficiently loaded our bags into the living area (I carried as much as I could be he was quite intent!). Every room was chilled to perfection and looked immaculate. 
Within minutes we had an army of employees at our Villa welcoming us and informing us of the breakfast details etc etc.
The breakfast options are great, is prepared for you at your choice of time in your Villa and the juices are freshly squeezed / blended. I admit that the breakfast was luke warm by the time we ate it but it was still very enjoyable. I recommend the "Healthy Start", flavoursome fruit with great yoghurt that is a perfect start to the hot, humid Balinese summer.
The bedrooms and bathrooms are very nice, and I found it hard to get out of the very comfortable bed! Nice sitting area beside the private pool, 2 lounge chairs on the pool and an outdoor shower that was greatly refreshing. Lots of natural light flooded the bathroom witch consisted of a spacious shower (huge shower head) and nice bath tub with jets.
The entrance to the Villa's driveway is manned 24 / 7 by very friendly security and the scooters they had for rent were new, great condition Honda's. Just gave them my name and Villa # and I was cruising the streets of Bali in no time.
Every night around 6 pm, 2 employees would come to spray the Villa to keep the bug problem down. Not once did we feel forgotten about, quite the opposite actually.
One night during heavy rain the power went out. I called the front desk and within 1 1/2 minutes there was someone flipping the switch on the fuze box with a smile.
To be honest, I felt a bit like a celebrity from being looked after so well by so many different people.
I found myself having good discussions and laughs with the guys at the reception / security and they would answer any question I had and book anything, anywhere no problem.
No major problems during our 10 day stay. O.k, so the TV wasn't an amazing flat screen but who goes on holiday to sit in front of the box? Also, it would of been nice to have a sound system in the living area or outside. Not a big issue as again, you will be out checking out the beautiful scenery! More than likely have your laptop with tunes anyway.
At the end of our 10 days our flight was at 10:20 pm but check out was 12:00 pm. We arranged a late check out at 2 pm, with us to leave our luggage somewhere behind reception until the driver took us to the airport. Once hearing that our flight was not until 10:20 pm, we received a call from the manager telling us to keep all of our things in our Villa until the arranged pick up time at 6:30 pm (with no extra charge). This little gesture impressed us both veery much and helped us out greatly.
It was a little sad to say goodbye to the crew that looked after us so well for the time we spent, but we both were ready to get back home. Not because of the Villa, just that 10 days in Bali is plenty, believe me!
I'm very shocked to see the two negative reviews before this. Are they sure it was this place?!?! 
As far as "GlobalTraveller1903's - A Con Job" review, if he was so concerned about the room wouldn't you have a quick bite to eat then get back to the Villa to sort it out ASAP? Not stay out until midnight partying?
I recommend The Residence Seminyak to anything contemplating on a place to stay. It's just off the main strip of Seinyak so therefore nice and quite but only 2 minute walk to the strip.
Try it out!
title: Great Location, Friendly Staff and Fantastic Villa.

Pool & terrace location meant no sun for sunbeds at any time of the day - disappointing of course.
Amenties - good but lacking final touches - iPod dock, coffee maker, TV in bedroom for example.
Towel rail loose keeps falling off, annoying as must happen every time staff replace towels so fix it!! #9
Both Air con and fan in bedroom work well but make a racket so need maintenance..
Breakfast - service prompt and on time, average quality for this style of accomodation
Location - better than ancticipated - couple of minutes walk to Seminyak Square & "eat street"; 10 minutes or so to beach; also well located the other side for Jl. Petitenget restaurants. 

Overall a good standard and a very pleasant stay. Would return so pros outway the cons.

text:
We stayed here with our 3 boys under 3 for four nights.  The location is great for walking in to the main street of Seminyak close to "eat street" and shops.  If you prefer to be walking distance to the beach I wouldn’t recommend these villas.  

The staff were so lovely, we had to move to another villa in the Residence as the first villa wasn’t so good for our boys, and the staff we so helpful and understanding.

The breakfast was good and cooked in our room each day.  The rooms were clean and well appointed. The pool was great, in the sun, very private.

If you are travelling with young children, my suggestion is to make sure all bedrooms are in the same building.  We stayed in 4 properties in 10 nights during our stay as all the villas had the bedrooms separate to the living areas.  This is great if you are travelling with other adults but not so good when you're with kids.
title: Fantastic location and friendly staff

text:
Loved it. Spacious, private, good service. 

Location is not the best if you want to be close to the beach (about 20 minutes walk). But you have your own PRIVATE POOL!!! Breakfast served every morning was really special. High walls around the compound give you all the privacy you need. Big, well appointed rooms and living room and kitchen impressed us - traveling from Japan. No bed bugs, clean linen - all good.

On the downside, a few minor things:  no towel racks inside or out, no where to hang your wet swimmers, no stereo, no stools for bar kitchen, kitchen has only bare minimum of utensils. I was a bit disappointed they served instant coffee rather than fresh local. 

But these were only minor - The Residence was WONDERFUL. 

Only thing I wasn't impressed with was Seminyak itself - definitely not the laid back, natural place I was hoping for. No elegance whatsoever. Restaurants were generally tacky, sidewalks dangerous, and the beach itself dirty by Australian standards. It's like what I though KUTA would be - a bit of a tourist ghetto.

text:
Stayed recently with a couple of friends in what is definitely the closest to deserving of the term "palatial" of any other hotel or villa in my experience - the photos online are accurate but don't do it justice

Booking was easy - the villa was ready when I checked in right on 2pm - finding it is a little tricky for some drivers - if you're not confident of the directions it may be worth getting a hotel transfer the first time - i knew where i was going and my taxi still got lost - always nice to visit kerobokan though....

Facilities are beyond description - the best of any villa of this nature I've seen to date - you can actually swim little breaststroke laps in the pool - the main bedroom has the classic outdoor balinese bathroom with the biggest jacuzzi imaginable (we had trouble filling ours and then gave up) - the pool surrounds are gorgeous (fountains, water features, gardens etc

Rooms are large and comfortably appointed - dvd players and tv's abound - furnishings are lovely as well as comfortable - the tiled floors are always tricky when wet but that's just a matter of practice

We got a reduced price and were then - very pleasantly - upgraded -- even so - I still think this would be good value for groups of at least 4 people (ie two - three bedrooms) - other properties in the area with anything like this level of comfort and size are probably double the price

Service is excellent - to the point of making you feel over-indulgent (this takes a lot for me when on holidays btw) - our breakfasts were cooked in our own kitchen to order and were better than average for hotel breakfasts in Asia - which - let's face it - are always a bit dodgy anyway - other room service options are available but the best restaurants in bali are just outside so why bother

I have been coming to Bali for more than 20 years and have stayed in all styles of accommodation - including other private villa properties - this one is the best -- I read the reveiw of every other poster on this page and had a good giggle at many (most actually except for tom and biantara) of the comments and have addressed some of those below as well - from the sounds of them the posters have no idea about bali at all -- please forgive any sarcasm - it's masquerading as humour -- the typos however are all my own ...

The location is great - the only thing that would make it better would be closer proximity to the beach - but then I probably (definitely) wouldn't be able to afford it - plus - who doesn't check the location of their hotel on a map??? most private villas are much further away from the beach btw - I can only think of a couple that are closer

Seminyak is not noisy - it's the nicer, quieter end of town - where all the upmarket boutiques and restaurants are - if you want noisy go to Kuta - the comment about Seminyak being strange was also (have to say it) strange - most of the expats live in Ubud actually - all my friends do except one and he would cack to hear himself described in this way

Footpaths - all of bali and most of indonesia (actually most of SE Asia) have the same style of road/footpath - I've read complaint comments like this before from people who obviously don't research their holidays very well - walking around is neither uncomfortable nor unsafe - unless you somehow thought that it wasn't going to be extremely hot in Bali and have never walked around in SE Asia before

$50 per day for a driver and car and petrol is phenomenal value - the poster didn't get a professional tour guide bcause they didn't pay for one - this poster has seriously unreasonable expectations - driver means exactly that - driver - they know how to get you where you want to go and they are pleasant - that's about it

Room /hotel style service - no it's not a "real" hotel - it's a private villa - duh!  that's possibly the dumbest comment of the lot - private villa's have self-contained facilities with some central services (usually bookings, breakfast, cleaning etc) - the service at this establishment is exceptional - one visit to cook breakfast (yes cook - on the spot) and clean the kitchen, another visit to clean the whole premises and a final visit just before dusk to spray for mozzies and change the outdoor lighting around for evening (i loved that bit) - i found the comment about the toothbrush not being replaced very amusing as well

Child friendly ??? - can you imagine a private villa with a nice metal pool fence around the artisitcally placed infinity pool - seriously people - you should have gone to Nusa Dua with all the other family groups who don't actually want to be in Bali at all

As a final comment - the towels are a kind of oatmeal/taupe/tan shade which matched the room decor admirably - other than the toothbrush comment - this is my fave
title: Best ever - i will never stay anywhere else in Bali again

text:
I have not completed many hotel reviews in my lifetime. I believe that had I completed a review for each and every one of my hotel stays (which there are many), I’d be chastised by my overseas family for not spending that time speaking to them on the phone! However, the Residence Seminyak was certainly a property to comment on as I don’t believe that the current content available online accurately reflects the product that it is - a great villa with a fantastic central Seminyak location off a quiet alley that is also has affordable and fair prices. This is certainly a Villa property to consider if you are traveling to Bali for a short or long term stay. Since the Residence Villas are so large, the website photos can not capture the true size and comfort of Residence Villas. The rooms are large, fantastic quiet air-conditioning, very private outlook, and full day of sun over the pool areas (and shaded on the deck if you need a respite from the intense Bali sun). 

I may sound like a spoiled traveler, but the Grocer & Grind (a short stroll from the Residence Seminyak) is a great retreat for many reasons: outdoor/indoor/A-C seating high quality western food for a fraction of the price you pay at home. a decent cup of soy coffee free wireless (the Residence Seminyak’s wifi worked well and a high speed) I recommend going to Grocer and Grind when you’ve eaten too much indonesian or asian food and when you are keen to have some western favourites.

I've read other reviews regarding its location being down a side alley; some of the review were mixed. I can confidently say that the well-lit lane access to the Residence is actually it's strength - a couple minutes walk to the 'action' whilst just positioned away from the noise that comes from the main road. The maps currently available online and even googlemaps does not portray to the first time visitor just how central and convenient the property is.

Their staff are all very attentive and overall were genuinely friendly. Particularly the cooks who come to your villas (at your request) to prepare a full breakfast for you in your villa (and even cut the local mangoes that i purchased from the markets - they are truly a delight to the palate).

I had friends staying at other more 'well-known' villas in Seminyak which due to their international reputation and branding, have been able to develop a international clientele following which in turn, increases the costs (more demand for same properties) to travellers such as ourselves. In fact, having seen 'those' villas, they have begun to look a bit worn and tired despite pictures saying otherwise coupled with the higher price tag given its brand reputation. Nonetheless, I recommend that you consider the Residence Villa on your next stay as you'll likely encounter superior product, equivalent (if not better) central location, without paying a hefty price premium given its brand.

2 thumbs up for the Residence Villa - it certainly made my stay worthwhile and I would now consider going back to Bali for a holiday.
title: Great Location and Villas

text:
We stayed at Residence Seminyak 5 nights last september.

The hotel and its facilities:
Actually it's not a real hotel but rather a residence with a dozen villas.
That's not a concern as you get housekeeping, in house breakfast and phone numbers for home delivery if you want to dine in your villa.
However we were very disapointed by the in house breakfast.
At first it seems top chic: you have your own cook preparing breakfast in your kitchen at the hour you reserved.
But they were never on time (early or late), the food would arrive pre-cooked and was only warmed up in the kitchen.
In fact the eggs, toasts and pancakes were always cold when served.
The juice was not real fresh juice and they even charged me when I asked for an extra (cold) pancake.
Also if you reserve thru a travel agency you get a cheaper rate but then there are a few amenities that are not included, like airport transfert.
That was no big deal.
The manager is a young women from Singapor and is really friendly. We talked a lot and she gave us good tips on restaurants and place to go out nearby.

The villas:
The smallest was a 2 bedroom villa witch was HUGE! Actually clearly oversized for the 2 of us. The private pool was also huge.
The villas were nicely furnished though there were a few spots on the chairs and a weird smell of mould in the bathroom.
You have high-speed wireless internet access. There's also a flat TV with DVD player and you can borrow DVDs at the reception.
We were in villa n°9 witch is the closest to the road so you hear noise from traffic (especially motorbikes).
Go check their website: you can see a map of the resort and a few pictures.

The surroundings:
That's the major problem. Seminyak is a strange place full of wealthy expats and luxury resorts but with no proper roads!
Walking out there is uncomfortable and unsafe. There are no pavements and when they are, watch your step they have big holes.
At nights these roads get completly dark -especially the ones leading to the Residence- and you'd better take a flashlight with you.
You can always take a taxi: they're cheap, but they sometime forget to turn their taximeter on, or try to drive you to another place...
The regular fare for a short distance drive is RP 15,000.
You have to walk a good 15 minutes to get to the beach from the Residence, under the sun and in the middle of traffic (remember: no pavement).
Then you access the beach and can bargain for a beachchair. We payed RP 50,000 for 2 beachchairs for the day, but I'm sure you can get them for less.

Overall:
I score it 4/5. Though location and breakfast were unsatisfactory it's a very good ratio quality/price and the staff is friendly.
title: Great deal for a huge villa, but quite far from the baech

text:
Etter en uke i Uluwatu tilbragte vi 2 uker på Villa Jepun. Leiligheten var innbydende med et rimelig stort og privat basseng og en hyggelig takterrasse. Egen butler og renholdspersonale holdt både inne- og uteområde rent og pent og vi ble servert en nydelig frokost hver dag av fantastiske Made eller Dwika. Beliggenheten er kun noen få 100 meter fra «Eat Street» med et enormt utvalg av restauranter og barer. Ca 10 - 15 minutters gange til stranden. 
Leilighet og service burde resultere i full score, men jeg gir trekk for at vi - etter å brukt nærmere 70.000.000 IDR på et 14 dagers opphold - fikk beskjed om at vi evt måtte betale over 2.000.000 IDR for litt sen utsjekk avreisedagen. Svært unødvendig (leiligheten var ikke booket på nytt på vår avreisedag) og irriterende noe som vil resultere i at vi - dersom vi kommer tilbake til Bali også ved en senere anledning - også vil vurderer andre boalternativer i samme område.  Likeledes kan et godt tips være å bytte ut madrassene på utemøblene. 
Et hyggelig opphold med et fantastisk personale, men med en litt negativ og unødvendig avslutning.
title: Flott leilighet like i nærheten av Eat Street
